org.enhydra.shark.utilities.ldap

Interface LDAPClientInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ADLDAPClient, LDAPClient

    public interface LDAPClientInterface
    In order to be able to switch implementations of the client that is able to talk to the LDAP server I introduced this interface.
    Author:
    Veljko Zivkovic

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkPassword(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Connects to the LDAP server specified by LDAPOptions object, and checks given password.
      boolean doesGroupBelongToGroup(java.lang.String groupName, java.lang.String subgroupName)
      Connects to the LDAP server and retrieves wanted data.

      Connects to the LDAP server and retrieves wanted data.

      Used to retreive LDAPOptions object, which might be set other then default before calling getEntries. return LDAPOptions object.

    • Method Detail

      • getLDAPOptions

        LDAPOptions getLDAPOptions()
        Used to retreive LDAPOptions object, which might be set other then default before calling getEntries. return LDAPOptions object.

      • getAllGroupEntries

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllGroupEntries(java.lang.String username)

      • getUserByEmail

        java.lang.String getUserByEmail(java.lang.String email)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Connects to the LDAP server and tries to fetch user with the specified mail address.
        Parameters:
        email -
        Returns:
        the user id that matched the email address
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • checkPassword

        boolean checkPassword(java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String password)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Connects to the LDAP server specified by LDAPOptions object, and checks given password.
        Parameters:
        username - User distinctive name.
        password - Password to check for the given user.
        Returns:
        true if password is OK.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
